question: What is the relation between the orbital velocity and the radius of the orbit for a given planet?
option1: greater the radius of orbit, lesser will be the orbital velocity
option2: greater the radius of orbit, greater will be the orbital velocity
option3: orbital velocity is independent of radius of orbit
answer: greater the radius of orbit, lesser will be the orbital velocity
explanation: For a given planet, greater the radius of orbit, lesser will be the orbital velocity of the satellite. The Orbital velocity depends on the mass of central body and radius of orbit.
